title: Barista/Cashier
description:
Matcha Cafe Maiko Fort Lee is seeking a friendly and enthusiastic team player with impeccable customer service skills to join our team!

**We are looking for a full-time team member who can work 30-40 hours per week and part-time employees capable of working year-round.** 

**We are not seeking any seasonal hires, and only applicants capable of working through the end of summer will be considered.** We are willing to train any accepted applicants, and we offer a competitive starting hourly wage plus shared tips!

***YOU MUST HAVE AVAILABILITY ON WEEKENDS AND BE ABLE TO COMMIT AT LEAST 20 HOURS A WEEK! MUST BE ABLE TO WORK 1 WEEKEND DAY (Sat or Sun). THIS IS A REQUIREMENT!***

To be successful in this role, you should have impeccable customer service skills and the ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced work environment. You should be able to work various shifts and with diverse teams. Ultimately, you’ll ensure an excellent experience for our guests.

Matcha Cafe Maiko opened its first store in Hawaii with the goal of providing customers quality matcha with an authentic taste. All our products are imported straight from Uji, Japan. Uji is a place in the southern part of Kyoto and is renowned for making top-notch, highly-nutritious matcha.

**Responsibilities include:**

* Must be able to take orders accurately via a point-of-sales system in a courteous manner.
* Must be able to accurately prepare ingredients and make drinks, soft serves, parfaits and special menu items following the instructions of each individual request.
* Prepare the kitchen and ensure ingredients are readily available at all times.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and work on your feet for extended periods of time.
* Comply with health and safety regulations, and ensure the store is properly maintained and cleaned.
* Maintain inventory, including stocking inventory and managing the daily inventory count.
* Helping with kitchen prep, such as making batch ingredients from scratch.
* Closing tasks, such as cleaning the store, washing dishes and closing the register.
* Assisting customers with various needs.
* And more.

**Qualifications:**

* Impeccable customer service skills.
* Previous experience in the food industry along with any relevant training. Ice cream, baking or barista experience are all a plus.
* Must be able to commit at least 20 hours per week.
* Must be available to work at least 1 day on weekends.
* You must be able to clearly communicate in English. The ability to speak other languages (e.g., Korean, Japanese, Chinese, etc.) is a plus.
* Flexibility to work various shifts and with diverse teams.
* Must be 16 years and older.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $15.00 - $16.50 per hour

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Paid training

Shift:

* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Morning shift

Application Question(s):

* Can you work in the fall?

Experience:

* retail cashier: 1 year (Required)
* retail food preparation: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Estimator - Heavy Civil
description:
**Job Description:**

As an Estimator reporting to the Vice President of Estimating, you will:

* Prepare estimates for various infrastructure projects, including bridges, highways, airports, tunnels, and transit systems.
* Review and analyze contract documents, drawings, and specifications to fully understand project requirements.
* Perform and direct quantity take-offs for both unit price and lump sum bids, organizing the information in Excel.
* Create detailed unit price estimates by determining the necessary crews, equipment, and materials using HCSS, our estimating software.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Construction Management, or a related field, with 10+ years of estimating and project management experience.
* Minimum 5 years of experience estimating heavy civil projects, particularly over $100M in value.
* Strong communication skills to work with owners, suppliers, and subcontractors during pre-bid and post-bid phases.
* Experience in alternative project delivery methods like design/build or CMAR is a plus.
* The salary range for this position is $150,000 - $200,000 based on experience.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $150,000.00 - $200,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* New Rochelle, NY 10801: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Barista and Cashier
description:
**YOU MUST HAVE AVAILABILITY ON WEEKENDS AND BE ABLE TO COMMIT AT LEAST 18 HOURS A WEEK! THIS IS A REQUIREMENT! MUST BE ABLE TO WORK 1 WEEKEND (Sat or Sun).**

We are seeking full-time and part-time employees. We are willing to train any accepted applicants, and we offer a competitive starting hourly wage plus shared tips!

Gong Cha is one of the most recognizable bubble tea brands around the world today. Known for quality tea and service, Gong Cha has maintained its reputation against a growing number of competitors.

Since its establishment in 2006, Gong Cha has expanded to over 15 countries with 1700+ locations worldwide and growing. This includes Taiwan, Hong Kong, China, Malaysia, Philippines, South Korea, Japan, Singapore, Thailand, Macau, Cambodia, Brunei, Indonesia, Australia, New Zealand, Canada and USA.

To be successful in this role, you should have impeccable customer service skills and the ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced work environment. You should be able to work various shifts. Note: this position’s compensation includes salary and tips. Ultimately, you’ll ensure an excellent drinking experience for our guests.

**Job Description:**

* Must be able to take orders accurately via a point-of-sales system in a courteous manner.
* Must be able to accurately prepare ingredients and make drinks following the instructions of each individual drink request.
* Prepare the kitchen and ensure ingredients are readily available at all times.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and work on your feet for extended periods of time.
* Comply with health and safety regulations, and ensure the store is properly maintained and cleaned.
* Maintain inventory, including stocking inventory and managing the daily inventory count.

**Qualifications:**

* Impeccable customer service skills.
* Previous experience in the food industry, preferably as a barista.
* Must be able to commit at least 20 hours per week.
* Must be available to work at least 1 day on weekends.
* You must be able to clearly communicate in English. The ability to speak other languages, such as Korean or Chinese, is a plus.

Please send your resume along with your hours of availability.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $15.00 - $16.50 per hour

Expected hours: 18 – 40 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule

Shift:

* 10 hour shift
* 12 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Day shift

Application Question(s):

* Can you work in the fall?

Experience:

* barista: 1 year (Preferred)
* retail food: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: HUD Compliance Specialist 2 (Residential Compliance)
description:
C+C Apartment Management LLC is recognized as an industry leader in management and real estate operations. Our team manages the day-to-day operations of over 23,000 residential dwelling units across approximately 400 multi-family buildings throughout the New York Tri-state area. The C+C portfolio contains market rate, mixed market rate, affordable and full tax credit/affordable properties.
  
  

Our mission is to provide exceptional property management services that meet the diverse needs of our various constituents, including our residents, the local community, government and financing agencies, and the owners of the properties. C+C offers a full breadth of management services to improve and enhance a property’s revenue, cost control measures, maintenance, financial reporting, and resident relations.
  
  

**Areas of Responsibility and Job Requirements:**  

Ensure compliance with all regulatory requirements for a mix of sites that include both Section 8 and LIHTC units and/or Public Housing Authority’s (PHA) regulatory and leasing requirements for a Section 8 Project Based Voucher (PBV) property, if applicable.
  
  

**Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:**  

* Completes Project Based Section 8 recertifications (and LIHTC recertifications if blended site)
* Complies with all EIV requirements (i.e. – have WASS ID, take EIV security awareness test annually, run EIV Reports, etc.)
* Prepares and send reminder notices to the residents at 120, 90, 60, and 30 days
* Commences holdover for Failure to Recertify by 2nd day of effective month
* Prepares for tenant file reviews with investors, syndicators, and monitoring agencies audits
* Assists in response to investor, syndicator, HUD, PBCAs and monitoring agency audits
* Completes monthly, quarterly, and/or annual reporting
* Tracks audits, reporting recertifications, etc.
* Prepare and ensure leases are signed by residents in PHA or section 8 PBV specific properties
* Submit leases online to PHA in a timely manner, if applicable
* Enter lease charge adjustments based on PHA rent determination, if applicable
* Outreach and assist residents with annual and interim recertification requests to PHA when applicable.
* Assist residents with any additional requests required by the PHA.
* Prequalify income & screening of applicant referrals for unit vacancies
* Handle all transfer-inquiries and work with respective agencies on processing requests.
* Meets with residents as needed
* Performs additional duties as assigned/needed.


**Minimum Education Requirements:**  

* High School Diploma or equivalent
* Bachelor’s degree, preferred


**Minimum Years of Experience Required:**  

* 2-3+ years’ experience in affordable housing with recertification experience or affordable multi-family leasing or compliance.


**Additional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**  

* Proficiency in computer applications including Microsoft Office MS Excel, required
* Proficiency in Yardi Affordable, required
* Section 8 or Tax Credit Certification, required
* Knowledge of Section 8 rent determination.
* Experience with Yardi and entering lease charges.
* Strong organizational skills with high attention to detail
* Must have excellent communication skills
* Bilingual, Spanish is a plus.


**Competencies/Essential Job Functions:**  

This position consists mainly of sedentary work. The position may require exertion of up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects, including the human body. The role involves sitting most of the time.
  
The incumbent is required to have close visual acuity to perform activities such as: viewing a computer; extensive reading and visual inspection involving small defects. The incumbent is also required to have visual acuity to determine the accuracy, neatness, and thoroughness of the work assigned or to make general observations of facilities or structures.
  
* This role frequently requires incumbent to talk and hear, expressing or exchanging ideas by means of spoken work and the ability to receive detailed information through oral communication, and to make distinctions in sound.
* This role occasionally requires incumbent to climb, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, crawling, reach, stand for long periods of time, walk, push, pull, feel and touch objects with fingers, palm, and hands and to lift up to 10 pounds.


**Work Environment:**  

The incumbent may occasionally be subject to environmental conditions (protection from weather conditions, but not necessarily from temperature changes.
  
The incumbent may occasionally be subject to noise sufficient to cause the worker to shout in order to be heard above the noise or vibration.
  
  

**Other Duties:**  

Please note that this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of this position. Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities of this position at any time with or without notice.
  
  

Please note that this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of this position. Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities of this position at any time with or without notice.
  
C+C offers competitive compensation and benefits and tremendous potential with a growing residential real estate developer/builder organization.
  
C+C is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

title: Assistant General Manager 3 (Property Operations)
description:
C+C Apartment Management LLC is recognized as an industry leader in management and real estate operations. Our team manages the day-to-day operations of over 23,000 residential dwelling units across approximately 400 multi-family buildings throughout the New York Tri-state area. The C+C portfolio contains market rate, mixed market rate, affordable and full tax credit/affordable properties.
  
  

Our mission is to provide exceptional property management services that meet the diverse needs of our various constituents, including our residents, the local community, government and financing agencies, and the owners of the properties. C+C offers a full breadth of management services to improve and enhance a property’s revenue, cost control measures, maintenance, financial reporting, and resident relations.
  
  

**Areas of Responsibility and Job Requirements:**  

Responsible for assisting the General Manager (GM) in the oversight of all operational aspects at a particular development/asset. The AGM, will assume partial operational control of the asset in the absence of the GM
  
  

**Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:**  

* Manages the Assistant General Manager (AGM) and other site-specific administrative staff
* Oversees and implements site-specific operational policies and procedures to ensure maximum performance by all employees
* Responsible for the implementation of regulatory compliance efforts and leasing coordinated efforts (i.e., continuous occupancy management, logistical coordination of move-ins/vacates/turnover)
* Supports and effectively manages on-site LIHTC and/or Section 8 administration and compliance.
* Oversees payroll and paid time off for site-employees, and monitor staff overtime
* Plans, executes, and enforces site-specific operational policies and procedures to ensure maximum performance by all employees
* Oversight and follow-up on all violations issued by City, State and Federal agencies
* Procure all vendors, services and necessary materials transparently and in accordance with C&C policies and procedures, and ensure that spending is aligned with budget projections, and actively reviews and approves invoices
* Mitigation and aggregation of pre-acquisition Housing Quality Standards (HQS) violations, which include uploading completed NE-2 forms onto the Division of Tenant Resources (DTR) portal
* Oversee implementation and effectuation of all resident A/R collections + legal arrears process
* Oversight of rent collection and resident arrears outreach follows guidelines issued by NYCHA, as applicable
* Work with counsel and other parties on tenant arrears, insurance matters and other legal issues as they arise
* Actively pursue tenant arrears and initiates non-payment proceedings
* Oversee BAEZ (mold survey & remediation) mitigation + reporting process as required by NYCHA reporting requirements
* Closely monitors, and supervises staff responsible for all trackers required by C&C management, NYCHA, government entities, partners, etc.
* Oversees the coordination with Builders on construction and resident relocation, as applicable
* Historical tracking and monitoring of monthly resident outreach notifications, working closely social services, community affairs and community leader teams
* Responsible for preparing and submitting of NYCHA related reports no later than the 5th of each month as a NYCHA requirement
* Work closely with Development + L+M Builders teams as well as interface with related partners, stakeholders and ownerships groups
* Responsible for enacting and enforcing organizational initiatives/SOPs
* Closely monitors performance of their direct reports and coordinates with HR on progressive disciplinary measures
* Plays a critical role with development team(s) in executing both short- and long-term initiatives/strategies across both the residential and retail components.
* Oversees incident reporting efforts – ensuring that all parties (site-security, leadership, insurance and legal teams) are engaged, and details are properly recorded
* Manages the violation process until completion
* Oversees and ensures that all CAM charges/allocations, multi-entity cost-sharing allocations, AR/AP, MOR variance explanations, operating and CAPEX budget-preparation are effectively handled
* Supports the leasing team on any/all renewal, lease termination and/or lease negotiations
* Liaise with Community Affairs to ensure resident feedback is incorporated into property operations and supports any/all L+M/C&C Community Affairs initiatives, with social services team/agencies to support the at-risk residential population and residents as needed
* Maintains full accountability and plays a direct leadership role in supervising agency-specific regular inspections (i.e. REAC, MOR, API, etc.).
* Works closely and collaborate with Asset Management team as well as any/all partners, stakeholders, and co-developers to drive additional value and control expenditures
* Manages all CAPEX projects – working closely with AM, builder’s group and RM on bidding/leveling and execution of contract docs.
* Manages retail/commercial operations pursuant to the lease agreements
* Manages the unit turnover process - include bid-leveling, estimating, and awarding process
* Strategizes and logistically coordinates (operationalize) major projects/initiatives and/or PILOT programs as trend-setters for the larger portfolio
* Engages and serves as direct point of contact for Agency Officials/Representatives (i.e., HPD, HCR, DCA, NHA, HMFA, ESDC, HUD, NYCHA etc.)
* Coordinates BBRI, OCAF, MU2M efforts – at times, directly handling the submissions
* Conduct property inspections to verify work performed by maintenance staff and identify areas that may need additional attention.
* Ensure that staff are trained in all required applications and other tools required to perform their duties. Similarly, confirm that staff understand their roles and responsibilities and that they can achieve desired results.
* Attend Tenant Association meetings as necessary
* Works closely with security team on security-related initiatives


**Minimum Education Requirements:**  

* Bachelor’s degree preferred or a combination of work experience, education and professional designations, certifications
* Preferred Certifications: RAM, ARM, AHM, LIHTC and CPM


**Minimum Years of Experience Required:**  

* 3+ years of experience in Property Management Operational role(s) with a college degree -or-
* 4+ years of experience in direct APM/AGM role at similar scale/scope properties (without a college degree)


**Additional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**  

* Must be proficient in Microsoft Office applications
* Proficiency in Yardi required
* Must have experience in residential housing (market-rate and/or affordable) and regulatory compliance
* Strong understanding of Building Finance and PM-specific Financial Reporting
* Strong understanding of Regulatory Compliance (Rent-Stabilization/Fair Housing/Section 8, etc.)
* Building system knowledge required
* Must have project management experience
* Must possess exemplary customer service skills
* Must display ability to complete tasks/projects on-time


**Competencies/Essential Job Functions:**  

This position consists mainly of sedentary work. The position may require exertion of up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects, including the human body. The role involves sitting most of the time.
  
  

* The incumbent is required to have close visual acuity to perform activities such as: viewing a computer; extensive reading and visual inspection involving small defects.
* This role frequently requires incumbent to talk and hear, expressing or exchanging ideas by means of spoken work and the ability to receive detailed information through oral communication, and to make distinctions in sound; engage in repetitive movements with the wrist, hands, and fingers by typing, reach, picking, pinching, typing or otherwise working, primarily with fingers rather than with the whole hand as in handling.
* This role occasionally requires incumbent to climb, balance, stoop, stand for long periods of time, walking and/or moving about on foot to accomplish tasks particularly for long distances; moving from one work site to another or occasionally in narrow aisles, hallways, or passageways; feel and touch objects with fingers, palm, and hands, lift up to 10 pounds.


.
  
  

**Work Environment:**  

The incumbent may occasionally be subject to environmental conditions (protection from weather conditions, but not necessarily from temperature changes.
  
The incumbent may occasionally be subject to noise sufficient to cause the worker to shout in order to be heard above the noise or vibration.
  
  

**Other Duties:**  

Please note that this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of this position. Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities of this position at any time with or without notice.

Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities of this position at any time with or without notice.

title: HUD Compliance Manager - PACT (Residential Compliance)
description:
C+C Apartment Management LLC is recognized as an industry leader in management and real estate operations. Our team manages the day-to-day operations of over 23,000 residential dwelling units across approximately 400 multi-family buildings throughout the New York Tri-state area. The C+C portfolio contains market rate, mixed market rate, affordable and full tax credit/affordable properties.
  
  

Our mission is to provide exceptional property management services that meet the diverse needs of our various constituents, including our residents, the local community, government and financing agencies, and the owners of the properties. C+C offers a full breadth of management services to improve and enhance a property’s revenue, cost control measures, maintenance, financial reporting, and resident relations.
  
  

**Areas of Responsibility and Job Requirements:**  

Oversees Compliance Specialists. Leads and directs the work of others to ensure compliance needs are met. In addition, has a portfolio of their own units to complete recertifications and the list of other items under the compliance Specialist. When applicable, ensure compliance with all Public Housing Authority’s (PHA) regulatory and leasing requirements for a Section 8 Project Based Voucher (PBV) property.
  
  

**Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:**  

* Directly supervise Compliance Specialists.
* Ensure appropriate leases are signed by residents.
* Submit leases online to PHA in a timely manner.
* Ensure lease charge adjustments are updated based on PHA rent determination.
* Complete and submit monthly reporting required by senior management and the PHA.
* Maintain property vacancy list and PHA provided applicant waiting list.
* Prequalify income & screening of applicant referrals for unit vacancies.
* Track and maintain all transfer inquiries and work with PHA on processing requests.
* Handle the collection of rent payments and security deposits.
* Assist residents with annual and interim recertification requests to PHA.
* Performs additional duties as assigned/needed.


**Minimum Education Requirements:**  

* High School Diploma or equivalent
* Bachelor’s degree, preferred.


**Minimum Years of Experience Required:**  

* 5+ years’ management experience in affordable multi-family leasing or compliance in affordable housing with recertification experience


**Additional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**  

* Must be fluent in Mandarin and/or Cantonese (must be able to read, write, and speak proficiently).
* Proficiency in computer applications including Microsoft Office MS Excel, required
* Proficiency in Yardi Affordable, required, and experience with entering lease charges
* Blended Section 8 &Tax Credit Certification, required
* General knowledge of property management department functions such as: A/P and A/R, various housing subsidies, rent stabilization, leases, site marketing, and unit leasing, required
* Knowledge of Section 8 rent determination.
* Experience in supervising staff, preferred
* Strong organizational skills with high attention to detail
* Must have excellent communication skills
* Bilingual, Spanish is a plus.

* This role frequently requires incumbent to talk and hear, expressing or exchanging ideas by means of spoken work and the ability to receive detailed information through oral communication, and to make distinctions in sound.
* This role occasionally requires incumbent to climb, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, crawling, reach, stand for long periods of time, walk, push, pull, feel and touch objects with fingers, palm, and hands and to lift up to 10 pounds.

title: REGISTERED NURSE: DETOX RECOVERY CENTER PER-DIEM NIGHT
description:
Day
7:00PM - 7:00AM
Per Diem
Nursing
Nyack, NY
$49.00
per hour
DESCRIPTION
As part of the Montefiore Health System, we offer the quality of a premier academic medical center and the caring of a community hospital. We’re committed to the health and well-being of Rockland County’s residents and our team members, and offer flexible opportunities for full-time, part-time, and per diem employment.


**RN’s benefit from:**


* The clinical excellence of the Montefiore Health System
* Opportunities for growth through training and continuing education
* Equal Opportunity Employment
* Zero tolerance policy for discrimination, harassment and abuse
* Fair employment practices, including equal treatment in hiring, promotion and compensation
* WE CARE code of conduct for all team members

**A Great Place to Live**


Just 35 miles from New York City, Rockland County offers friendly communities, natural beauty, outdoor pursuits, convenient shopping and easy access to New York City. While Rockland County has plenty to offer, both the mountains and the beach are within a few hours’ drive.

  


The Registered Professional Nurse is responsible for managing, delegating, coordinating and providing nursing care through utilization of the nursing process. The above is accomplished with the utilization of effective communication skills with patients, significant others and members of the multidisciplinary health care team.


QUALIFICATIONS
1+ years’ med/surg, psychiatric, or addiction nursing required. Associates degree in nursing required. BSN preferred. National Certification in area of practice preferred. N.Y.S. Nursing License, Current N.Y.S. Registration. BLS.

title: Revive Production Associate
description:
Revive Production Associate


Department: Operations


Reports To: Warehouse Supervisor


Full-Time, Non-Exempt Position (Hourly)


Pay Range: $17 - $19 per hour


Location: Carlstadt, NJ

  

Company Description:


Revive offers technology solutions to help brands maximize inventory productivity via data-driven refurbishment services. We are creating circular & sustainable collections with brand partners by extending the life of every garment we touch. Revive’s focus on technology, innovation, and sustainability is changing how consumers and brands view the garments they buy and produce.


Job Summary


Our Revive Production Associates are trained in all aspects of each station.. This position requires a detailed eye to ensure all quality standards are met or exceeded. As a Revive Production associate, you will be cross trained to float between stations based on where the business need is.


This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by the Revive Production Associate at Hemster. Is not intended to include all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.


Duties / Responsibilities:

* Keep a safe work environment by maintaining a clean and organized workspace.
* Process, sort and organize incoming shipments for Revive.
* All incoming orders should be received, processed and inspected following Revive SOP’s.
* Uses the Revive Platform for all stations to move orders from inbound through outbound.
* Ability to examine, identify and record any damages/flaws located on the product.
* Inspecting work completed by vendors to ensure quality meets our Revive standards.
* Ensures all QC inspected garments are correctly sorted by their garment ID to the proper stations by the end of each workday.
* Uploads photos into the portal during garment inspection and marketplace prep
* Ensure all orders are packaged according to Revive standards.
* Ensure boxes are correctly sorted for shipping to the proper brand.
* Pick, pack and ship items for order fulfillment
* Assist with the maintenance of the facilities including vacuuming, dusting, and general cleaning.
* Other duties involved include breaking down boxes, removing trash and recycling.


Requirements:

* Ensure Revive’s standards for efficiency, accuracy and quality are always met for all stations.
* Ability to read, write, and understand English.
* Self-motivated and team-oriented
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Good problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot problems.
* Ability to navigate online portal & basic computer skills.
* Strong organization skills, attention to detail and follow through to resolve any outstanding issues.


Physical Requirements:


While performing this job a Garment Production Associate is regularly required to stand, reach, and kneel. Physical ability to lift and move 50lbs. Specific vision abilities such as close vision, distance vision, color vision, and ability to adjust focus.


Position Type / Expected Hours of Work:


This is a full-time, non-exempt position. This position is eligible for overtime. Work hours are typically 40 hours a week, Monday thru Friday. Weekend availability needed.

 **We Offer:*** Medical
* Dental
* Vision
* Paid Time Off
* 401k

  

**COVID VACCINATION REQUIRED**

title: Food Server and Cashier
description:
Flavor N' Spice is a cozy casual Guyanese take-out restaurant. We serve West Indian and Caribbean Food. Some of our dishes include the Guyanese Chinese Cusine with items such as Chicken Fried Rice, Spared Rib Tips, Jerk Pork Fried Rice, Chicken Curry and Roti, Goat Curry, Duck Curry and many more items. We are looking for someone trained in using our cash register system, and someone familiar in the food. We are also open to training.

Server position includes:

taking out customers food

cleaning work station

assist with filling fridge, stacking bread rack, and putting out other items

There are slow times but during lunch and dinner the pace can really fasten. Employee must know how to multi-task when taking care of customers, answering the phone and taking orders included. Be nice to the customers and you will earn tips!

title: Network Infrastructure Project Manager
description:
**Description**

* **The network project manager** will coordinate efforts with agency and external teams, equipment vendors, and other specialists during hardware deployment, and network setup.
* Their expertise will help ensure network system integration and interconnectivity of all health department locations including the new PHL facility and other agency-managed sites.

**Experience and Capability:**

* A minimum of three (3) years of experience in program or project management, specifically in **network infrastructure deployment** in a new construction environment.
* Greater consideration will be given to proposers who have **experience in healthcare or health lab environments.**
* A bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
* **PMP, PMI, or related project management certifications are a plus.**
* **Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) or other relevant network certifications are a plus.**
* A proven ability to manage budgets and financial aspects of projects, with **experience in new construction projects and/or healthcare budgeting a plus.**
* A minimum of three (3) years of experience in IT network architecture, protocols, and best practices, with an understanding of the unique requirements of health lab facilities.
* Experience working with network infrastructure, vendors, contractors, and specialized healthcare equipment providers.
* Proficiency in project management tools and software, including **salesforce** **project tracker, MS Project, and Visio.**
* Excellent organizational and leadership skills.
* Effective communication skills and interpersonal abilities.
* Must be able to work both on-site and, if needed, remotely.

**Scope of Services:**

* The Network project managers would perform a variety of services, both in-person, and, if needed, remotely, including but not limited to:
* Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to define project objectives, scope, and requirements to network infrastructure, including LAN, WAN and WLAN.
* Identify potential risks and developing mitigation strategies to address issues that may arise during the course of network projects such as equipment failure, resource constraints or scope changes.
* Troubleshoot technical issues for both hardware and software, evaluate technical solutions, and ensure IT projects meet technical IT specifications and standards.
* Work with internal and external network architects and engineers to design scalable, secure, and resilient network architectures that meet organizations requirements.
* Oversee the configuration, deployment, and testing of network devices such as routers, switches, firewalls, and wireless access points to ensure optimal performance and security.
* Implement security measures such as access controls, encryption, VPNs, and intrusion detection/prevention systems to protect the network from unauthorized access and cyber threats.
* Develop and implement disaster recovery plans, backup strategies and redundant network configurations to minimize downtime and data loss in the event of network failures or disasters.
* Develop and execute comprehensive project plans, including timelines, budgets, and resource allocation, to ensure the successful deployment of network infrastructure, with a specific focus on the unique requirements of health lab facilities for multiple potential projects.
* Collaborate with network architects and engineers to design a robust and scalable network infrastructure that meets the high-performance demands of all Department locations and supports critical research initiatives.
* Identify and engage with network infrastructure vendors and contractors as well as specialized health lab equipment suppliers.
* Coordinate the efforts of cross-functional teams, including network engineers, technicians, lab specialists, and contractors, to ensure the seamless integration of network infrastructure and all Department locations
* Monitor and manage project budgets, track expenses, and report on financial performance, with a focus on accommodating the specialized equipment and technology required for IT operations.
* Establish and enforce quality standards for network infrastructure installation and configuration within all IT settings across the agency, conducting regular inspections and audits to meet rigorous healthcare research standards.
* Identify potential risks and issues unique to Health Department/IT operations, develop mitigation plans, and ensure project progress aligns with established goals, including compliance with healthcare regulations.
* Maintain clear and effective communication with internal and external project stakeholders, including health researchers, laboratory personnel, and IT teams, providing regular updates on project statuses, milestones, and issues.
* Ensure comprehensive documentation of network infrastructure designs, configurations, and maintenance procedures, particularly tailored to health lab compliance and research standards.
* Oversee the transition of network infrastructure and Department facilities to operational status, ensuring seamless performance and reliability in support of critical healthcare research activities.

Job Type: Contract

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Long Island City, NY 11101

title: Host / Takeout
description:
Hungry for Hospitality?
  
  

FIRE UP YOUR CAREER! Anthony’s Coal Fired Pizza has the FRESHEST ingredients any way you slice it! When you put good things in the Oven, good things come out. Everything served HOT, HOT, HOT, including our signature pizzas that are cooked in a 900-degree Oven. You're the last piece of the pie! People are our greatest ingredient for success and the most important part of who we are! At Anthony’s, you’ll be a part of an exciting, passionate, and dedicated team with growth opportunities. title: Restaurant Server
description:
If you want to work for a restaurant company that focuses on scratch made coal fired pizza with the highest quality ingredients, then Anthony’s Coal Fired Pizza might just be the place for you!
  
  

We don’t just use a lot of marketing speak to recruit you; when we say you will be a member of our family, we really mean it. With highly competitive compensation packages, great benefits and long-term growth and career opportunities, we want to invest in you. We build teams of top performers, so you will be surrounded by a group of passionate managers, regional leaders and a support center focused entirely on making you and your restaurant successful. Check out our job openings and apply to become part of something bigger today. We look forward to welcoming you to our family.
  
  

Our servers provide genuine and friendly service that is responsive to all of our guests’ needs resulting in an exceptional dining experience. Each server’s primary objective is to meet the needs of our guests – not only in their section but throughout the restaurant.

* Welcome and greet guests; making sure they feel comfortable and know that you’re there to personally take care of them.
* Find ways to make guests feel special through personalized service and genuine concern for their experience.
* Maintain outstanding service levels not only in designated table section, but for all of our guests.
* Process orders and payments quickly and efficiently according to ACFP standards so our guests’ wonderful experience will not be compromised.
* Completes all running responsibilities throughout the shift including restocking and replenishing service supplies, condiments, and service ware.

* Learn the ACFP menu in order to answer guests’ questions and make suggestions
* Have knowledge of alcoholic service laws and standards

* Have a good knowledge of dining room and service procedures and functions
* Be able to work in a standing position throughout their shift
* Maintain a great attitude and smile throughout their shift
* Be able to operate a point-of-sale system

* Practice high sanitary standards, including washing hands frequently

Prior experience is highly desirable in one of the following roles and brands: server, servers, waiter, waiters, wait staff, runner, restaurant crew member, restaurant team member, customer service or other part time FOH restaurant jobs at Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza, Yard House, Tap 42, Lazy Dog, Cheesecake Factory, TGI Fridays, Longhorn, True Food Kitchen, Maggiano's, Chick-fil-A.

title: Store& Assistant Catering Operations Manager
description:
At Ben & Jerry's we live by our motto, "if it's not fun, why do it" and bring peace, love, and ice cream into the daily fabric of the Ben & Jerry's life. Here, we put people first.
  
  

We strive to be the best employers and citizens of each neighborhood we call home by donating to charities, volunteering our time, participating in local events, and by giving back to our communities!If you are the one, tell us why and send in your resume. We look forward to you joining our euphoric journey and our amazing leadership team! Share the love!
  
  

Hourly-$18-$20 an hr
  
  

* Maintains the "Peace, love and ice cream" culture at all times (greets customers, offers samples, demonstrates store pride, etc)
* Follows all applicable food safety rules, (including dress code and food storage rules)
* Use of POS system/ basic cash handling
* Available late summer nights (past 11pm) and weekends (some holidays)
* Must be watchful and controlling with labor and cost of goods matrix this is vital
* Has to be accountable for driving sales up and keeping costs down


Store Manager is generally a full time opportunity and offer excellent benefits.
  
  

Prior experience in one of the following roles and brands is highly desirable: general manager, catering manager, operations manager, supervisor, shift lead, Restaurant assistant general manager or other restaurant job at Ben &b Jerry's, Chick-fil-A, Popeyes, Starbucks, Panera Bread, McDonalds, Taco Bell, Burger King, In-N-Out Burger.
  
  

**Assistant Catering Operations:**  

This position primary responsibility is for the overall success of the day to day operations of the catering business out of the riverwalk scoop shop. It is also important that the candidate has a creative mind with fresh ideas on growing a business with positive, upbeat attitude and ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
  
To implement and manage the retail operations of our busy New Jersey (potentially assist for Florida/CT other territories) catering business under the Chief Administrator & Catering Manager to include the planning, operations, equipment maintenance, marketing, and customer satisfaction.
  
To ensure that the development and implementation of all systems fully support and comply with all franchise operating systems (square, salesforce, etc.).
  
To ensure the proper hands-on training support is provided to catering staff members. Training that focuses on daily operations, customer relations, staff orientation and cleanliness.Prep before and after events, attend events to help ensure operational excellence, motivate, and train new staff (Ensures proper presentation, portion control and maintenance of serving temperatures) Establish a motivating work environment that actively encourages and supports employee involvement with an eye towards possible job advancement that is aligned with individual goals.
  
Supervise the implementation of all catering policies and procedures. Supervise and organize the tasks needed to maintain the overall operations including catering equipment & staff appearance, customer service, cleanliness, compliance with all safety and operating standards, merchandising and promotional execution. Leadership and motivating skills including the ability to build strong relationships with customers and staff.Must be willing to work outside in heat & move lift, push, pull, carry, and place objects approximately 25 +/- lbs.
  
  

Requirements/Responsibilities
  
  

**Store Manager Requirements:**  

* Have an infectious smile and a sense of urgency
* Must love making people happy
* Must be able to work 6-8 hours on your feet
* Are able to lift at least 20 lbs
* Are able to work in a fast-paced environment
* Has a “can do” attitude and is a people person, has a infectious smile and willing to grow with our network
* Must have at least 2 years of retail food experience
* Must understand small business operations and all its related concepts
* Honest with integrity!
* Must be available to work the nights, weekends and holidays, this is a desert business, its not a 9-5 job
* Must understand technology and be great with social media and paperwork


Store Manager is generally a full time opportunity and offer excellent benefits.
  
  

Prior experience in one of the following roles and brands is highly desirable: general manager, catering manager, operations manager, supervisor, shift lead, Restaurant assistant general manager or other restaurant job at Ben &b Jerry's, Chick-fil-A, Popeyes, Starbucks, Panera Bread, McDonalds, Taco Bell, Burger King, In-N-Out Burger.

title: Care Manager 5 Boros
description:
**Hand In Hand Development, Inc,** CMA is a NYS DOH approved Early Intervention Agency that provides evaluations, service coordination, and therapeutic services for children birth to 3 in all 5 boroughs, upstate and Long Island. Hand In Hand is also an approved Care Management Agency (CMA) under the lead health home of the Collaborative for Children and Families (CCF), and provides comprehensive care management, health promotion, transitional care, and family support for children and young adults from birth to age 21. Hand In Hand Development is the largest CMA in New York and is recognized as a leader and innovator in the provision of care management services.


**Salary Range:** Fee for Service range of $150-$300/case


**Location:** Travel Throughout the 5 Boros


**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**


This position is responsible for the overall coordination of services to meet the goals of the client and their families. This is accomplished by building relationships with the caregiver(s) and care team and acting as a liaison to other agencies and ensuring they receive all necessary services and implementing the plan of care. Our aim is to provide the highest quality of care management services by complying with regulatory guidelines and meeting agency standards.


A Care Manager works with children who are Medicaid insured and may have a medical and/or emotional need. They ensure the member receives proper care and assists the family by facilitating their access to services on a monthly basis.


* Assists families to plan and obtain services appropriate to the needs of the child and family.
* Completes the necessary assessments to identify child’s medical, social, educational and psychological needs. Then develops a comprehensive plan of care based on the identified needs.
* Coordinate and monitor the delivery of identified services and the proper use of resources.
* Deliver at least 2 client-centered health home services to each client on a monthly basis.
* Attends and participates in continuing education, ongoing staff in-services and quarterly meetings.
* Responding to feedback and corrections from company quality assurance in a timely fashion.
* Perform related duties as assigned by the Supervisor.
* Maintain compliance with all company policies and procedures.
* Other job-related duties as assigned.


**Education and/or Work Experience Requirements:**


Bachelor's degree is required, preferred fields of study are Psychology, Sociology, Social Work, or Human Services; or a minimum of 2 years of job-related experience providing case management or medical focused care coordination services to individuals with special needs.


* Must be able to attend in-person trainings & meetings in our Midwood, Brooklyn office approximately once per quarter.
* Each case requires a monthly in-home visit and the position can be hybrid once they have a full case load of approximately 20 cases.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including ability to effectively communicate with clients, and healthcare providers.
* Need to use electronic health record systems, databases, and other computer-based tools to manage client information and maintain accurate records.
* Strong organizational skills to help manage multi-family case load.
* Willingness to meet with families in their homes or communities.
* Bilingual is a plus.
* Computer proficiency (MS Office- Word, Excel and Outlook).
* Valid NYS issued ID or driver’s license; must be willing to travel throughout Orange County.
* Ability to work independently and to carry out assignments to completion within the parameters of instructions given, prescribed routines, and standard accepted practices.


**Physical Requirements:**


* Ability to travel to numerous locations to meet with clients, attend meetings and visit healthcare facilities.
* Ability to safely and successfully perform the essential job functions consistent with the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state and local standards, including meeting qualitative and/or quantitative productivity standards.
* Ability to maintain regular, punctual attendance consistent with the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state and local standards.
* Must be able to lift and carry up to 35 lbs.
* Must be able to talk, listen and speak clearly.

title: Nursing Supervisor Per Diem #94
description:
**Who We Are:**


St. John’s Episcopal Hospital is the only hospital providing emergency and ambulatory care to the densely populated, culturally and economically diverse, and medically underserved populations of the Rockaways and Five Towns in southern Queens County and southwestern Nassau County, New York. Celebrating over 110 years of community care, the 257-bed facility provides people of all faiths with comprehensive preventive, diagnostic treatment and rehabilitative services, regardless of ability to pay.


***Come Grow With Us!***


**Type:** Per diem


**Shift:** Varies


**Hours:** Varies


**Pay:** $74.00 - $80.00 Hourly


**Job Summary:**


It is the responsibility of the Administrative Supervisor to ensure and maintain adequate and competent levels of patient care in all areas of operation. The Administrative Supervisor collaborates with the Asst. VP of Nursing/Patient Care Services and the VP of Nursing/Patient Care Svc. in facilitating nursing care. This individual assumes responsibility for all administrative activities in the absence of the administrator on premise. The Administrative Supervisor is guided by a broad knowledge of current nursing theory and practice and of principles of management and supervision.


**Responsibilities:**


* Plans, organizes, and directs nursing services to provide continuity of patient care
* Plans and organizes work to obtain effective use of professional, ancillary and support services and/or equipment to ensure adequate and competent patient care
* Demonstrates critical thinking skills in problem solving
* Interprets policies and procedures to nursing staff
* Provides informal on-the-job training and guidance to all nursing staff to develop and maintain safe nursing practices
* Assumes responsibility for Nursing Department in absence of the Assistant Vice President for Patient Care and the Vice President for Patient Care Services
* Disciplines staff as warranted. Recommends on- going disciplinary actions to Assistant Vice President for Patient Care Services and the appropriate Nurse Manager
* Maintains adequate and safe levels of staffing in emergency situations (e.g., inclement weather) so as not to compromise level of patient care
* Communicates effectively with staff, patients, visitors and peers
* Supervises and assess unit staff in areas assigned


**Requirements:**


* NYS RN License Required
* Bachelor’s Degree Required, Master’s Preferred
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects at various stages of development
* Must demonstrate good organizational skills and ability to set priorities

title: Certified Hemodialysis Technician - #6
description:
**Who We Are:**


St. John’s Episcopal Hospital is the only hospital providing emergency and ambulatory care to the densely populated, culturally and economically diverse, and medically underserved populations of the Rockaways and Five Towns in southern Queens County and southwestern Nassau County, New York. Celebrating over 110 years of community care, the 257-bed facility provides people of all faiths with comprehensive preventive, diagnostic treatment and rehabilitative services, regardless of ability to pay.


**Come Grow With Us!**


**Type:** Part-Time (30 hours biweekly)


**Shift:** Varies


**Hours:** Varies


**Pay:** $27.30 - 28.69 per hour


**Job Summary:**


It is the responsibility of the Hemodialysis Technician to provide direct and indirect patient and technical services under the supervision of a Registered Nurse in the dialysis unit. The Hemodialysis Technician is also responsible to transport patients, assist the Registered Nurse(s), and perform clerical duties as assigned. The incumbent is guided by knowledge and training in the techniques of hemodialysis and by verbal and/or written instruction.


**Responsibilities:**


* Sets up and operates the hemodialysis machine under the supervision of the RN
* Provides direct patient care, including initiating monitoring/discontinuing dialysis, and meeting hygiene and nutritional needs
* Performs and documents results of technical duties such as monitoring of water treatment equipment and other related functions
* Mixes solutions according to formulas
* Primes dialyzer and dialyzer bloodlines with the appropriate solution
* Takes and records patients' pre-dialysis and post-dialysis vital signs


**Requirements:**


* Certified Clinical Hemodialysis Technician certification
* 18 Months Hemodialysis experience
* At least 2 years' experience in a health related field
* High School Diploma required

title: Paralegal- IP and Privacy
description:
**Text to Apply! Text JOIN3363 to 845-400-TEAM (3363)**


**COMPANY OVERVIEW:**  

Balchem Corporation develops, manufactures, and markets specialty ingredients that improve and enhance the health and well-being of life on the planet, providing state-of-the-art solutions and the finest quality products for a range of industries worldwide. Our corporate headquarters is located in Montvale, New Jersey and we have a broad network of sales offices, manufacturing sites, and R&D centers, primarily located in the US and Europe. Founded in 1967, Balchem is a publicly traded company (NASDAQ – “BCPC”) with annual revenues over $900 million and a market cap exceeding $4.0 billion. The company consists of three business segments: Human Nutrition & Health; Animal Nutrition & Health; and Specialty Products. Balchem employs over 1,400 people worldwide who are engaged in diverse activities, committed to developing the company into global market leadership positions. To learn more about our dynamic, stable and growing company, visit www.balchem.com.


**POSITION SUMMARY:**  

The Senior Paralegal will report to the Assistant General Counsel with primary responsibility over intellectual property at Balchem. This person will perform a variety of complex legal, administrative, and clerical duties requiring the application of specialized knowledge and understanding of technical and legal terms and procedures within the legal department primarily in the areas of Intellectual Property, Contracts, and Litigation. This person will work closely with the Assistant General Counsel to help oversee and manage the intellectual property portfolio for the organization along with other corporate functions. Compensation package is commensurate with experience and Balchem offers generous benefits which include medical, dental, vision, 401K with company match and a hybrid work model.


**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**  

* Manage and oversee U.S. and international trademark and patent portfolios
* Coordinate and manage intake of newly acquired trademark and patent portfolios
* Under attorney supervision, prepare and file U.S. trademark applications, responses to office actions, requests for extensions of time, statements of use, declarations of use, declarations of incontestability, renewals, and other filings related to U.S. trademark prosecution
* Under attorney supervision, correspond and coordinate with outside counsel to file foreign trademark applications, renewals, provisional refusal responses, oppositions/cancellations and other documents
* Under attorney supervision, correspond and coordinate with outside counsel for recordation of ownership transfers, assignment agreements, change of name filings, and any other updates with the USPTO and foreign patent and trademark offices
* Assist with other intellectual property projects including demand letters, trademark license agreements, and IP due diligence
* With regard to contracts, receive requests for agreements of all types, prepare certain standardized form agreements and some ad hoc agreements, review them for accuracy under attorney supervision, and manage contracts during their lifespan
* Serve as primary in-house support staff in litigation, claims, and demands matters
* Maintain and update files in the internal share folder
* Code and process invoices for payment when related to job areas
* Other duties as assigned

**REQUIREMENTS:**  

* College diploma or equivalent preferred, plus at least five years of experience or combination of experience and specialized paralegal or legal secretarial education
* Experience in a corporate legal department is preferred
* Completion of a paralegal program is desirable
* Ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment on various matters of significance
* Ability to compose, type and assemble information in proper legal form
* Set up and maintain a wide variety of legal files, records and reports
* Follow complex oral and written instructions
* Prepare routine legal documents
* Communicate effectively, both orally and in writing
* Commute to our Montvale, NJ headquarters office
* Hybrid work model (expected to be in the office 3-4 days a week)
* Establish and maintain effective working relationships with those contacted in the course of work
* Ability to handle multiple, concurrent projects and generate high quality work product
* Strong organizational skills and high level of attention to detail
* Ability to multi-task, take initiative and be adaptable Highest level of integrity, sound judgment and strong work ethic
* Knowledge of basic legal concepts, principles, and procedures including calendaring and filing practices; legal and business terminology, spelling, grammar and punctuation; MS Office suite including PowerPoint and Excel; operation of basic office equipment including computer, telephone, fax, copier, and calculator
* Ability to efficiently accomplish the above duties and responsibilities

**WORKING CONDITIONS:**  

* Office environment
* Work is mostly sedentary

#IN


Balchem is committed to a workplace culture that values and promotes diversity, inclusion, equal employment opportunities, and a work environment free of harassment and hostility.

title: Associate Account Specialist
description:
We are hiring for an **Associate Account Specialist** to join our Oncology Sales team! The role will play a key role in ensuring patients adherence to the prescribed test cadence with a focus on improving patient outcomes. The role requires identifying areas of improvement in clinical workflows, test fulfillment, internal systems and processes. In addition, it requires working closely with health care providers, clinical administrative staff, sales, logistics and internal team members to address the challenges identified.


**LOCATION:** This territory includes North Jersey. Key areas include Parsippany, Morristown, Livingston and Summit.


**Primary Responsibilities:**


* Build relationships with key personnel at Oncology accounts to facilitate workflow improvements as well as ensure smooth operations of blood draw and order execution. This requires being in the field for the majority of your workweek to fully understand the clinic's operations and clinic phlebotomy/lab workflows.
* Analyze and monitor patient testing to ensure that patients remain on the protocol prescribed by the Oncologist. You will be responsible for managing the end-to-end patient process at the clinic, from scheduling to the completion of blood draws, ensuring that the experience is efficient and seamless.
* Document and streamline clinic workflows to enhance efficiency and patient experience, ensuring all processes are clearly understood and followed
* Solve challenges that arise related to fulfilling test orders. This can include but not limited to, EMR challenges, Natera systems or operations issues or Phlebotomy limitations
* Utilize and maintain reports of key performance indicators (KPIs) related to patient retention and fulfilled order volume
* Navigate dashboards and internal tools to identify patients and track status of orders, patient results, and overall patient journeys
* Be a key team player within the sales organization who can partner with internal stakeholders, such as sales reps, patient coordinators, territory managers, etc. to achieve the best outcomes for the patient and the provider
* Educate providers on the tools and resources that Natera provides to facilitate test order management
* Respect and maintain the confidentiality of laboratory and financial information of patients and the company
* Practice and adhere to all company policies and regulations
* Follow Compliance procedures and participates in all relevant Compliance training


**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree preferred or Associate's degree with minimum of 4 years of relevant experience
* Medical assistant or nursing background is a plus
* Minimum of 2 years of experience in clinical support/clinical logistics, or caregiver experience such as OCN or other


**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**


* Thrives in ambiguous environments
* Exceptionally bright, flexible, self-motivated, and results oriented with strong interpersonal and analytical skills
* Ability to think strategically as well as execute tactically
* Must act with a sense of urgency
* Have a strong desire to work in a fast-pace environment and must work independently with an internal drive to be successful
* Excellent organizational and communication skills (written and verbal) with demonstrated ability to effectively present to both internal and external customers
* Effective time management skills required with a demonstrated ability to assess and prioritize
* Proficient in Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel; Gmail
* Fluent in understanding data spreadsheets and technologies although the Patient Retention Specialists will continue to lead patient identification and vetting
* Demonstrated ability to quickly learn software and reporting systems


**Physical Demands & Work Environment:**


* Duties are typically performed in a medical office or hospital setting.
* This position requires the ability to use a computer keyboard, communicate over the telephone and read printed material.
* Duties may require working outside normal working hours (evenings and weekends) at times.
* 50-75% travel required


**In addition to the base salary, we offer a competitive commission structure that rewards performance. We also provide a car allowance and a gas card as part of the compensation package.**

**OUR OPPORTUNITY**



Natera™ is a global leader in cell-free DNA (cfDNA) testing, dedicated to oncology, women's health, and organ health. Our aim is to make personalized genetic testing and diagnostics part of the standard of care to protect health and enable earlier and more targeted interventions that lead to longer, healthier lives.



The Natera team consists of highly dedicated statisticians, geneticists, doctors, laboratory scientists, business professionals, software engineers and many other professionals from world-class institutions, who care deeply for our work and each other. When you join Natera, you'll work hard and grow quickly. Working alongside the elite of the industry, you'll be stretched and challenged, and take pride in being part of a company that is changing the landscape of genetic disease management.


**WHAT WE OFFER**



Competitive Benefits - Employee benefits include comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life and disability plans for eligible employees and their dependents. Additionally, Natera employees and their immediate families receive free testing in addition to fertility care benefits. Other benefits include pregnancy and baby bonding leave, 401k benefits, commuter benefits and much more. We also offer a generous employee referral program!



For more information, visit www.natera.com.



Natera is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace environment, and welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. Inclusive collaboration benefits our employees, our community and our patients, and is critical to our mission of changing the management of disease worldwide.



All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, and will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable laws.


*If you are based in California, we encourage you to read this important information for California residents.*



Link: https://www.natera.com/notice-of-data-collection-california-residents/



Please be advised that Natera will reach out to candidates with a @natera.com email domain ONLY. Email communications from all other domain names are not from Natera or its employees and are fraudulent. Natera does not request interviews via text messages and does not ask for personal information until a candidate has engaged with the company and has spoken to a recruiter and the hiring team. Natera takes cyber crimes seriously, and will collaborate with law enforcement authorities to prosecute any related cyber crimes.



For more information:  

* BBB announcement on job scams
* FBI Cyber Crime resource page
company_description: Natera is driven by a passion for elevating the science and utility of prenatal testing.

title: Tele-Organizer
description:
The SEIU Communications Center is hiring Tele-Organizers to make phone calls on behalf of labor unions and our allies. Right now, our primary focus is on helping our clients to grow their unions' membership, and on encouraging union members to support their unions' political action programs. We also expect to play a role in support of the effort to turn out union members and voters for the Harris-Walz ticket and down-ballot candidates across the country who speak to the concerns working families in their communities share.  

The primary responsibility of the Tele-Organizer is to efficiently handle telephone calls with a level of professionalism and aptitude that exceeds client expectations.  

This is a remote part-time, per diem position. On the job, SEIU-CC Tele-organizers can expect to place outbound phone calls or receive incoming phone calls. The work will mainly consist of speaking on the telephone with union members or the public. The work is performed using a provided script—in conjunction with background briefing material and accumulated knowledge and skill—to provide information, gather information, make an appeal for action, or process requests. *Qualifications*  

* Some college
* Excellent English reading and speaking skills
* PC or Mac, high-speed internet connection, ear + mic solution
* Comfort with typing and modern computer use, web site and smartphone app navigation
* Ability to assertively use the telephone as an organizing tool
* Active interest in civics and social movements, political action and grassroots organizing is essential, and previous work experience in these areas is desired
* Prior telephone, door canvass, or outbound sales experience is plus
* Prior experience working in the health care or education sector is a plus
* Fluency in Spanish, Chinese, Korean, or Russian is a plus
 *Job Requirements*  

* Take no action that would harm the relationship between SEIU-CC clients and their constituents, or between SEIU-CC and its clients; be truthful, respectful, and perform work with integrity
* Complete required trainings on process of performing call handling tasks
* Complete required campaign content briefings and/or trainings for specific call handling projects
* Read and understand provided literature related to specific call handling campaigns
* Ask questions of supervisory staff if campaign objectives or instructions are unclear
* Differentiate between ordinary and extraordinary situations, manage each as such
* Share call handling challenges and successes with supervisory staff
* Stay on task, completing work in an efficient manner
* At all times, respect and maintain the confidentiality of telephone contacts, acting in accordance with SEIU-CC data security policy and applicable law


The starting wage is $21.40 per hour  

SEIU-CC is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes all qualified applicants, regardless of gender, race, age, sexuality, or disability.  

  

This is a part-time, per diem position and employees accept the shifts they are available to work.  

Typical shift offerings are on Monday through Thursday, plus Sunday, with Friday and Saturday off.  

Typical shift hours offered are:
  

3pm to 11pmET or 5pm to 11pmET  

2pm to 10pmCT or 4pm to 10pmCT  

1pm to 9pmMT or 3pm to 9pmMT  

Noon - 8pmPT or 2pm to 8pmPT

title: Supervisory IT Specialist (PLCYPLN)
description:
**Duties**
----------


* Reviews, analyzes and evaluates program development, progress and performance of the program management contract staff.
* Incumbent applies an extensive knowledge of management concepts, methods, practices, and processes of planning, engineering, and scientific practices (e.g., Lean Six Sigma, DIWIA, PMP, etc.)
* Responsible for keeping the Commander/Director informed of the state of IM/IT by leading organizational inspection programs to ensure subordinate functions are being administered in an effective manner.
* Develops a Requirements List to capture analytical and technical recommendations on implementation and improvement.
* Incumbent demonstrates proficiency with the Project Management Process as defined by the Project Management Institute (PMI).

**Requirements**
----------------


### **Conditions of Employment**


* Appointment may be subject to a suitability or fitness determination, as determined by a completed background investigation.
* Incumbent must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret (Noncritical-Sensitive (NCS) National Security Risk) security clearance.
* Temporary duty (TDY) travel may be required up to 25% of the time.
* Incumbent may be required to work outside of normal duty hours.

### **Qualifications**


**Who May Apply: US Citizens**  

  

In order to qualify, you must meet the experience requirements described below. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community; student; social). You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience. Your resume must clearly describe your relevant experience; if qualifying based on education, your transcripts will be required as part of your application. Additional information about transcripts is in this document.  

  

**Specialized Experience GS-14:** One year of specialized experience which includes: 1) Conducting studies to determine information management/ information technology (IM/IT) requirements for computer software and hardware design; AND 2) Developing new or modified IT system plans and policies; AND 3) Conducting testing to identify and remedy issues in program development; AND 4) Presenting technical reports or briefings for IT software/hardware design. All experience areas shall additionally demonstrate each of the following competencies: 1) Attention to Detail, 2) Customer Service, 3) Oral Communication, and 4) Problem Solving. This definition of specialized experience is typical of work performed at the next lower grade/level position in the federal service (GS-13).  

  

Some federal jobs allow you to substitute your education for the required experience in order to qualify. For this job, you must meet the qualification requirement using experience alone-no substitution of education for experience is permitted.
### **Additional information**


* Male applicants born after December 31, 1959, must complete a Pre-Employment Certification Statement for Selective Service Registration.
* You will be required to provide proof of U.S. Citizenship.
* One year trial/probationary period may be required.
* Direct Deposit of Pay is required.
* Selection is subject to restrictions resulting from Department of Defense referral system for displaced employees.
* If you have retired from federal service and you are interested in employment as a reemployed annuitant, see the information in the Reemployed Annuitant information sheet.
* This is a Career Program (CP) 34 - Information Technology/Cyber Management position.
* Multiple positions may be filled from this announcement.
* Salary includes applicable locality pay or Local Market Supplement.
* Payment of Permanent Change of Station (PCS) costs is not authorized, based on a determination that a PCS move is not in the Government interest.

  



* Benefits
