title: Assistant General Manager
description:
**About Old Navy**
------------------


Forget what you know about old-school industry rules. When you work at Old Navy, you’re choosing a different path. From day one, we’ve been on a mission to democratize fashion and make shopping fun again. Our teams make style accessible to everyone, creating high-quality, must-have fashion essentials for the whole family, with love, season after season.


We opened our first store in 1994 in San Francisco and have been on a roll ever since. We cultivate a community of playful personalities that thrive in a fast-paced environment where our employees can be their most authentic selves. Here, we’re family.

**About the Role**
------------------


As an Assistant General Manager, you’ll work with the General Manager to create, execute and maintain the store business plan. You’re a critical leader in driving profitable sales growth through all aspects of the store including; customer and product operations, merchandising, and talent development. You are responsible for supporting the execution of the store strategy to achieve performance goals. You’ll lead others by teaching and coaching Assistant Managers, Leads, Experts and Brand Associates to cultivate a high performing team to deliver a best-in-class experience to our customers. You are expected to lead the team in the absence of your General Manager.

**What You'll Do**
------------------

* Build effective teams and drive a culture of high performance and engagement.
* Support the execution of performance goals and developmental plans for store team.
* Support strategies and processes using a customer-centric mindset to delivers results and drives store sales.
* Recruit, hire, onboard, develop and lead a team of managers and employees.
* Be accountable for team performance through teaching, coaching and providing feedback to build capabilities.
* Own assigned area of responsibility.
* Implement action plans to maximize efficiencies and productivity.
* Perform Service Leader duties.
* Ensure consistent execution of standard operating procedures.
* Represent the brand and understand the competition and retail landscape.
* Promote community involvement.
* Leverage an omni-channel to deliver a frictionless customer experience.

**Who You Are**
---------------

* A current or former retail employee with 2-4 years of retail management experience.
* A high school graduate or equivalent.
* A good communicator with the ability to effectively interact with customers and your team to meet goals.
* Determined to effectively lead and inspire others to learn and grow through coaching and mentoring.
* Driven by metrics to deliver results to meet business goals.
* Agreeable to work a flexible schedule to meet the needs of the business, including holiday, evening, overnight and weekend shifts.
* Organized and utilize time management and prioritization skills to effectively manage multiple tasks in an environment with competing demands.
* Knowledgeable of our business and the retail environment and it to evolve store strategies to help meet goals.
* Able to maneuver around the sales floor, stockroom and office and lift up to 30 pounds.
* Ability to travel as required.
* Ensure all compliance standards are met.

**Benefits at Old Navy**
------------------------


* Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Old Navy, Gap, Banana Republic and Athleta, and 30% off at Outlet for all employees.
* One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.\\*
* Employees can take up to five “on the clock” hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.\\*
* Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employee’s base pay.\\*
* Employee stock purchase plan.\\*
* Medical, dental, vision and life insurance.\\*
* See more of the benefits we offer.
* *For eligible employees*


Gap Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. We have received numerous awards for our long-held commitment to equality and will continue to foster a diverse and inclusive environment of belonging. In 2022, we were recognized by Forbes as one of the World's Best Employers and one of the Best Employers for Diversity.  

  

**US Candidates**  

Please note that effective, June 30, 2022, Gap Inc. will no longer require any of its employees to wear face masks or require proof of COVID vaccination, unless required by local or state/provincial mandates or as part of Gap Inc’s quarantine guidelines after being exposed to or testing positive for COVID. title: Front of House Manager
description:
**SUMMARY:**  

The Front of House Manager is responsible for managing the daily service operations of Court Street Restaurant and Coffee Shop, including the selection, development and performance of Front of House staff. In addition, they oversee the inventory and ordering of paper goods and cafe supplies, work to operate within labor and supply budgets and ensure that guests are satisfied with their experience. The Front of House Manager reports to the Director of Operations.  

  

**Financial Reconciliation and Administration:**
  

  

The Front of House Manager must:
  

* Take ownership of and react as needed to all P & L statements, inventories of FOH supplies, cash variances, FOH labor costs and budgets and other financial administrative tasks as necessary to ensure profitability within their department.
* Ensure and take responsibility for the accurate daily accounting for all cash and receipts in the cash drawer and float.
* Enter and ensure accuracy of all daily sales reports and tip allocations.
* Compile weekly deposits out of all cash received within the week.
* Utilize invoice organization systems to ensure all orders placed are accurate in quality, quantity and invoiced by the vendor at the agreed upon price.
* Work with Kitchen Manager to ensure menu items are priced appropriately for their COGs.
* Take ownership of the monthly inventory count of FOH supplies and its accuracy.

  

**Human Resources:**
  

  

The Front of House Manager must:
  

* Advertise, select, hire, train, and mentor FOH staff.
* Ensure that the complete customer hospitality experience as visioned by the executive team is executed on consistently through training and personal example.
* Hold regular ‘one on one’ catch ups with FOH staff and periodic staff meetings as needed.
* Recognize staffing problem areas within the FOH and rectify (remove, retrain, repurpose employees as needed to maximize performance) in a timely and efficient manner.
* Ensure acceptable levels of Food Handlers licenses are maintained within the FOH.
* Understand daily staffing requirements proactively and schedule staff appropriately. React to staff overages in a timely and efficient manner in order to maintain FOH labor costs within budget.
* Approve all timesheets in a timely (daily or every other day) and accurate manner including managing employees who are chronically tardy or staying in excess of their shifts without prior clearance.
* Ensure that all employees represent the values and principles of TRCU Coffee LLC for customer service and adhere to the policies and procedures as set forth in HR documents, such as handbooks and policy notices
* Front of House Manager must exemplify the values of the company at all times, through personal presentation, customer service and attitude.

  

**Department of Health:**
  

  

The Front of House Manager must:
  

* Ensure and take responsibility for the management and follow up of daily cleaning within their department and define measures set in place in order to achieve and maintain an A grading at every visit.
* Create and maintain a system of checks to ensure all temperatures (hot, cold and standing) are logged and equipment is maintained as necessary to ensure appropriate operational capacity.
* Work vigorously and as often as necessary with pest control and staff to ensure minimal to no levels of infestation that would jeopardize our A grade.
* Ensure all team members are adequately informed in DOH standards and following policies for personal conduct put in place to ensure DOH regulations are being followed (i.e. wearing appropriate head and footwear, labeling and placing lids on beverages, not eating on the floor).
* Ensure that there is always an assigned Food Handler’s license holder on premises to interact with DOH inspectors.

  

**Operational Systems and Procedures:**
  

  

The Front of House Manager must:
  

* Update and maintain order guides and pars to ensure consistent stock of supplies and availability of menu items.
* Ensure adherence to staff meal and staff retail coffee policies.
* Update, maintain and ensure adherence to all policy and procedural manuals, operational checklists and systems.
* Communicate with Kitchen Manager to ensure the active, accurate and timely updating of POS, menus, delivery and website platforms including the addition of all new items, archiving of old items, and accuracy in pricing of these items.
* Maintain a list of areas/items that need attention to bring the facility into good repair. Work through this list where possible and draw to the principles attention all that require external contractors.
* Maintain a communications log to ensure accurate and timely communications throughout the day.

Range and Promotions: The Front of House Manager must:
  

* Work with Director of Operations and Kitchen Manager to develop and pursue all possible avenues for revenue development.
* Work with Director of Operations and Kitchen Manager to create an evolving range of seasonal products and specials throughout the year.
* Working with Director of Operations and Kitchen Manager, develop and coordinate (including communication of) specific offers for special days such as Mother’s Day, Thanksgiving etc.


Information Dissemination and communication: The Front of House Manager must:
  

* Ensure that all staff are updated on menu, scheduling, and procedural policies and changes.
* Ensure smooth and evolving communication with customers and patrons including placement of A-boards as well as internal communication opportunities within the shop; and
* Author and update messaging within the shop to alert customers and patrons to new and exciting menu options and offers.
* Work with Director of Operations to ensure ongoing availability of high quality photos, videos and other marketing assets for use on website, email marketing and social platforms.

  

**Physical Requirements:**  

  

The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 lbs., while performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to stand for long periods of time; frequently walk, use hands and fingers, handle or feel, reach with hands and arms, talk and hear; occasionally sit, climb or balance, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions, provided such accommodations do not create an undue hardship for the company.  

  

**Equal Opportunity:**  

  

You must be legally able to work in the US. Otherwise, we pride ourselves on providing and creating opportunities for equal employment for all of our employees and applicants without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, military service, disability, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, or sexual and other reproductive health decisions. Equal employment opportunity applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leave of absence, compensation, and training.  

  

**Disclaimer:**  

  

This job description is not an exhaustive list of all functions that the employee may be required to perform. The employee may be required to perform additional functions. The company also reserves the right to revise the job description in part or whole at any time.

title: Service Manager
description:
We love curious minds who are passionate and looking to grow. We value people who work hard and never settle, people who can find fun in everything. Someone who makes both guests and staff comfortable in their presence. Someone who takes pride in successes. We are, and are seeking, someone who is accountable for mis-steps. We invite you to set the table with us and keep the vibe alive. We love what we do and are looking for people who share that. Come join our team and thrive!




Why Work with Us?


Compensation & benefits:

* Industry competitive salaries
* Health insurance
* Equinox Membership
* Quarterly bonuses
* Paid Time Off
* Consistent schedule with 2 days off

Job Description


The Manager’s primary responsibility is to manage and develop our teams, following our F&B Director's specifications and guidelines ensuring total guest satisfaction. This is achieved by:


* Coordinating, leading, and directing our FOH Team Members
* Exercising good judgment and decision making in escalating concerns and aggressively resolving issues
* Preparing and leading daily pre-shifts
* Reviewing daily minutes from service and creating action plans for improvement
* Responsibility for compliance with OSHA, local health and safety codes as well as Company safety and security policies
* Holding team members to the proper Image and Appearance Guidelines including proper hygiene
* Partnering with the Executive Chef, GM, FOH Managers on training and educating all team members
* Holding team accountable to policies and procedures
* Implementing and holding strict standards for safety and sanitation as well as overall organization
* Holding team members to the proper Image and Appearance Guidelines including proper hygiene
* Train, coach, and counsel managers, supervisors and employees to achieve their career goals and maximize their potential


Required experience


* Experience in a high-volume restaurant (3+ years Manhattan experience)
* Maintain high-quality standards, clean work habits with a great attention to detail
* Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Familiar with industry’s best practices, equipment, and procedures
* Ability to meet physical and scheduling demands of the position, including, walking, standing, or lifting heavy items for extended periods and open availability to work nights, weekends, and holidays
